definition: (of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)

sentences.english: Political parties and voters have no freedom of speech, assembly and association in society.
sentences.chinese: 各政黨和選民沒有言論集會和結社自由。

sentences.english: Ban citizen's groups. Deny the freedom of society.
sentences.chinese: 禁止民間組織，禁止結社自由。

sentences.english: We continue to hope that the Russian leadership will ensure that such freedom of association remains secure.
sentences.chinese: 我們已一再要求俄羅斯領導人繼續保障結社自由。

sentences.english: Freedom of association is regarded as a threat by dictators .
sentences.chinese: 結社自由是政黨專制或大人物專權的剋星。

sentences.english: The freedoms to assemble and associate also apply in cyberspace.
sentences.chinese: 集會與結社自由同樣適用於網絡空間。

definition: (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another, abbr. for 薪盡火傳|薪尽火传[xin1 jin4 huo3 chuan2]

various sages/refers to the classical schools of thought, e.g. Confucianism 儒[ru2] represented by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3], Daoism 道[dao4] by Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3] and Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3], Mohism 墨[mo4] by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], Legalism 法[fa3] by Sunzi 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3] and Han Feizi 韓非子|韩非子[Han2 Fei1 zi3], and numerous others
to pass on the light of Buddha

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
(of family members) separated from one another/scattered about/dispersed/(math.) discrete
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
